courseSection0.text:
College of Nursing
University Tower (UTWR), 300 (Third Floor)
407-823-2744
ucfnurse@ucf.edu
Dean: Dr. Mary Lou Sole
Chair for Department of Nursing Systems, Hugh F. and Jeannette G. McKean Endowed Chair in Nursing, Professor: Dr. Mona Shattell
Director for RN to BSN and Concurrent ASN to BSN Post Licensure BSN Programs, Senior Lecturer: Dr. Stephen Heglund

li.Acceptance to the university does not co: Acceptance to the university does not constitute admission to the upper division nursing program. Separate application to the limited access program must be made directly to the College of Nursing by the posted deadline. For application deadlines, please visit http://www.nursing.ucf.edu.
li.Admission to the University must be comp: Admission to the University must be completed by the program application deadline.
li.All applicants must have a minimum overa: All applicants must have a minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0
li.All applicants must be enrolled in a Sta: All applicants must be enrolled in a Statewide Articulated AS in Nursing from a Florida College System institution and have completed a minimum of two semesters. Individuals who received an AS in Nursing or attended nursing school other than a Florida College System or State University System institution should review the Nursing - RN to BSN Program.
li.All applicants must be working toward Li: All applicants must be working toward Licensure as an RN.
li.All applicants must have completed the U: All applicants must have completed the UCF General Education Program (GEP) requirements or completed an AA degree from a Florida College System or State University System institution or have no more than a total of 9 credit hours remaining to meet UCF General Education and/or Foreign Language graduation requirements.
li.All eight (8) Common Program Prerequisit: All eight (8) Common Program Prerequisites must be completed by the program application deadline with at least a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in each course.

courseSection0.text:
Acceptance to the university does not constitute admission to the upper division nursing program. Separate application to the limited access program must be made directly to the College of Nursing by the posted deadline. For application deadlines, please visit http://www.nursing.ucf.edu.
Admission to the University must be completed by the program application deadline.
All applicants must have a minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0
All applicants must be enrolled in a Statewide Articulated AS in Nursing from a Florida College System institution and have completed a minimum of two semesters. Individuals who received an AS in Nursing or attended nursing school other than a Florida College System or State University System institution should review the Nursing - RN to BSN Program.
All applicants must be working toward Licensure as an RN.
All applicants must have completed the UCF General Education Program (GEP) requirements or completed an AA degree from a Florida College System or State University System institution or have no more than a total of 9 credit hours remaining to meet UCF General Education and/or Foreign Language graduation requirements.
All eight (8) Common Program Prerequisites must be completed by the program application deadline with at least a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in each course.

p.BSN completion program only for individu: BSN completion program only for individuals who are enrolled in a statewide articulated A.S. in Nursing from a Florida public community or state college (12/2000 or later). Students who are enrolled in a Concurrent ASN to BSN program will take the NCLEX-RN after successfully completing the ASN portion of their program and prior to enrolling in their final BSN courses at UCF. Out-of-state instructional limitations apply to this degree program. For more information on this please visit https://apq.ucf.edu/files/Licensure-Disclosure-Nursing-Online-AS-to-BS.pdf

li.Students who change degree programs and: Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog year, including minors.
li.Students should consult with an advisor: Students should consult with an advisor in the College of Nursing Undergraduate Student Services Office for questions regarding completion of General Education Program requirements and Common Program Prerequisite requirements.
li.The courses designated in UCF General Ed: The courses designated in UCF General Education Program (GEP) and Common Program Prerequisites (CPP) below may be taken at a Florida College System or State University System institution.
li.A minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 2: A minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 2.5 and a minimum 2.5 GPA in the nursing major are required for continuation in and graduation from the nursing program
li.The courses designated in UCF General Ed: The courses designated in UCF General Education Program (GEP), civic literacy, and Foreign Language Requirements must be completed prior to enrolling in the third semester in the BSN program. Students may have no more than 9 hours of outstanding coursework in these two areas at the time of admission.

courseSection0.text:
BSN completion program only for individuals who are enrolled in a statewide articulated A.S. in Nursing from a Florida public community or state college (12/2000 or later). Students who are enrolled in a Concurrent ASN to BSN program will take the NCLEX-RN after successfully completing the ASN portion of their program and prior to enrolling in their final BSN courses at UCF. Out-of-state instructional limitations apply to this degree program. For more information on this please visit https://apq.ucf.edu/files/Licensure-Disclosure-Nursing-Online-AS-to-BS.pdf

Degree Requirements
Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog year, including minors.
Students should consult with an advisor in the College of Nursing Undergraduate Student Services Office for questions regarding completion of General Education Program requirements and Common Program Prerequisite requirements.
The courses designated in UCF General Education Program (GEP) and Common Program Prerequisites (CPP) below may be taken at a Florida College System or State University System institution.
A minimum overall undergraduate GPA of 2.5 and a minimum 2.5 GPA in the nursing major are required for continuation in and graduation from the nursing program
UCF Residency Requirement: 30 hours
The courses designated in UCF General Education Program (GEP), civic literacy, and Foreign Language Requirements must be completed prior to enrolling in the third semester in the BSN program. Students may have no more than 9 hours of outstanding coursework in these two areas at the time of admission.

li.Two years of one foreign language in hig: Two years of one foreign language in high school, or one year of one foreign language in college (or equivalent proficiency exam) prior to third semester in the BSN program.
li.Must hold licensure as a Registered Nurs: Must hold licensure as a Registered Nurse.
li.A criminal background check and mandator: A criminal background check and mandatory Drug Screening may be required prior to any clinical course and "on demand" for continuation in the program.
li.Complete all courses in major with at le: Complete all courses in major with at least a "C" (2.0)
li.Maintain a UCF GPA of 2.5 or above: Maintain a UCF GPA of 2.5 or above
li.Maintain a College of Nursing GPA of 2.5: Maintain a College of Nursing GPA of 2.5 or above
li.Prior to third semester in the BSN progr: Prior to third semester in the BSN program: 1) complete general education requirements or A.A. from a Florida College System or State University System institution; 2) complete civic literacy; and 3) complete foreign language admission requirement.
li.Continuous enrollment in a Statewide Art: Continuous enrollment in a Statewide Articulated AS in Nursing program of a Florida College System institution until completion and awarding of the Associate of Science in Nursing degree.
li.Selected courses may be offered at vario: Selected courses may be offered at various Orlando and Regional Campuses.
li.All AS to BSN courses are available onli: All AS to BSN courses are available online. Some classes and labs are also available in person on select campuses. Clinical practice requirements are completed in the student's home community. For more information visit http://www.nursing.ucf.edu
li.All students admitted to a BSN program w: All students admitted to a BSN program will be responsible for a subscription to the LEAP*RN student information database and repository.
li.Completion of all courses in major with: Completion of all courses in major with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better
li.Cumulative overall GPA of 2.5 or above: Cumulative overall GPA of 2.5 or above
li.College of Nursing GPA of 2.5 or above: College of Nursing GPA of 2.5 or above
li.This program must be completed in no mor: This program must be completed in no more than seven years from enrollment in the first BSN course within Core Requirements.
li.42 semester hours of upper division cred: 42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
li.60 semester hours earned after CLEP awar: 60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
li.30 of the last 39 hours of course work m: 30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
li.A maximum of 45 hours of extension, corr: A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
li.Complete the General Education Program,: Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
li.Contact Program Coordinator or HUT Advis: Contact Program Coordinator or HUT Advisor
li.Health Informatics and Information Manag: Health Informatics and Information Management Minor
li.Students are required to design an indiv: Students are required to design an individual plan of study with an advisor. Any changes to that plan must be made in consultation with the advisor. Failure to do so may result in a delay of program progression and/or graduation.
li.A maximum of 6 upper division credit hou: A maximum of 6 upper division credit hours of Nursing courses may be transferred from another institution.
li.Program Academic Learning Compacts (stud: Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm

courseSection1.text:
Electives

variable to meet degree requirements

courseSection2.text:
Foreign Language Requirements

Admissions
Two years of one foreign language in high school, or one year of one foreign language in college (or equivalent proficiency exam) prior to third semester in the BSN program.
Graduation
Must hold licensure as a Registered Nurse.

courseSection3.text:
Additional Requirements

A criminal background check and mandatory Drug Screening may be required prior to any clinical course and "on demand" for continuation in the program.
Complete all courses in major with at least a "C" (2.0)
Maintain a UCF GPA of 2.5 or above
Maintain a College of Nursing GPA of 2.5 or above
Progression Requirements:
Prior to third semester in the BSN program: 1) complete general education requirements or A.A. from a Florida College System or State University System institution; 2) complete civic literacy; and 3) complete foreign language admission requirement.
Continuous enrollment in a Statewide Articulated AS in Nursing program of a Florida College System institution until completion and awarding of the Associate of Science in Nursing degree.
Other:
Selected courses may be offered at various Orlando and Regional Campuses.
All AS to BSN courses are available online. Some classes and labs are also available in person on select campuses. Clinical practice requirements are completed in the student's home community. For more information visit http://www.nursing.ucf.edu
All students admitted to a BSN program will be responsible for a subscription to the LEAP*RN student information database and repository.

courseSection5.text:
Departmental Exit Requirements

Completion of all courses in major with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better
Cumulative overall GPA of 2.5 or above
College of Nursing GPA of 2.5 or above
This program must be completed in no more than seven years from enrollment in the first BSN course within Core Requirements.

courseSection6.text:
University Minimum Exit Requirements

A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.

courseSection8.text:
Additional Information

Honors Undergraduate Thesis
Contact Program Coordinator or HUT Advisor
Related Programs
Health Services Administration (B.S.)
Social Work (B.S.W.)
Certificates
Aging Studies Certificate
Related Minors
Health Sciences Minor
Health Informatics and Information Management Minor
Health Services Administration Minor
Psychology Minor
Advising Notes
Students are required to design an individual plan of study with an advisor. Any changes to that plan must be made in consultation with the advisor. Failure to do so may result in a delay of program progression and/or graduation.
Transfer Notes
A maximum of 6 upper division credit hours of Nursing courses may be transferred from another institution.
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses
None
Program Academic Learning Compacts
Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm
Equipment Fees
Part-Time Student: $25 per term
Full-Time Student: $50 per term
